channel.title: With the greatest respect
channel.description:
Continuing the discussion from [SFoL13: Pestilence (Day 2)](https://forum.imperium42.com/t/sfol13-pestilence-day-2/36045/3071):
While I understand the RL comes first, It's not unreasonable to ask how long the night will be. Games that take a long time to proceed drain people's WIM and generally affect activity levels. If you can't spare the time to start the day, find someone to help out - You have @FadeBlade, @Queen_Alfa and @Methnor who are all mods in this section who are not a player and could get the day started for you.

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: í42-Xblade
item.description:
Leaving an official response here:

RL > Forum games.

However, yes, it would’ve been nice if something was said or got someone else to do it.

However (part II), we also don’t know if Jammy couldn’t appoint someone else (much like forgetting someone’s birthday and ditching all your time for them, or random sickness or if you forgot to do something important).

Moleland:

You have @FadeBlade, @Queen_Alfa and @Methnor who are all mods in this section

Any of these guys could have been DM’d instead of posting this if you already know who to contact. Worst case scenario, message me – I’ve started a day before when someone else was occupied. Then, if you say greatest respect in a DM, I would totally believe you (even Jammy would have, too).

All in all, no one should ever call out a mod or dev (or even a player) like this in a public fashion, esp if you haven’t tried to DM before. If anything, a dev should’ve been DM’d if you’ve already tried to private message. While I may have been able to assist you if private messaged (and already tried to message Jammy), I cannot after a post like this.

Read full topic

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Weizen1988
item.description:
Ruby said she would get to it this weekend, this matter is resolved.

Read full topic

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Hippolytus
item.description:
Mole has said multiple times now that wasn’t his issue, it was more the accusatory tone - inquiring about a forum games delay is perfectly reasonable.

Read full topic

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Luxx
item.description:
There’s nothing sadder than complaining about having to wait a few days extra for someone to continue a forum game/roleplay because the person who runs it has been extra busy lately.

Be patient kids.

Read full topic

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Weizen1988
item.description:
Could it be phrased better? Possibly, but it contained all the information, she is busy, she will get to it when she has time, asking her will not speed it up, and that it will likely be this weekend. We are not robots, we have lives and things going on. Fun takes a back seat to real life, always.

Read full topic

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Icibalus
item.description:
Jammy is host
She can do what she want
Personally I’m fine with long nights so long as they don’t last too long and aren’t a regular feauture.

Also any sentence that starts with ‘No offense’ ‘I’m not being racist but’ and ‘With the greatest respect’ will turn out to be shit 90% of the time imo

Read full topic

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: KyoDaz
item.description:
People have IRL things going on, and it could be extremely serious.
A virtual game on the forums is nothing you should be worried about. Yes, it does lower activity levels but all you need to do is Ping Everyone anyways. I always log onto the forums every day and I aint even in a forum game.

Honestly I think this is something that was blown up way too much. Yes it is a bit disappointing for some players, but you have to respect other’s time. I’m going to leave it here unless I am needed to post, otherwise I am not posting anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
Did you not find the post linked passive aggressive? I did. Now, maybe people are bugging excessively, but that response felt directed at me. It’s not unreasonable to ask when a game will resume when there is no information available.

Read full topic

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Jazz
item.description:
Weizen1988:

That’s like saying “as long as I say “with all due respect” its not rude.”

it reminds me of “i’m not racist but…”

Read full topic

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Weizen1988
item.description:
That’s like saying “as long as I say “with all due respect” its not rude.” This matter is resolved though it seems.

Read full topic

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Hippolytus
item.description:
His title is “with the greatest respect” he is not trying to shame anyone with anything, just bringing up some reasonable points which were on a lot of people’s minds who were actually in the FoL were talking about. Don’t be rude and try start drama where there isn’t any.

Read full topic

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Weizen1988
item.description:
All I see is someone trying to publicly shame a mod into doing something when they have said they were busy. But whatever.

Read full topic

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
You’re missing the point. It’s not the delay that’s a problem, it’s the attitude of we are unreasonable to ask when the new day will start

Read full topic

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Weizen1988
item.description:
I hadn’t checked that other thread. My bad. Her point remains valid though. FoL is entirely voluntary and the mods doing it do it for fun. If it slows down for a few days and doesn’t change from night to day fast enough, go do something else for a while and wait.

Read full topic

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
Fair enough, I get that. Which is why a calm message outlining the situation as soon as you were aware the night would be delayed would go a long way to curbing prods. Anyone prodding you afterwards would be a jerk. Anyway, I’ve said what I wanted to, hope you have free time this weekend

Read full topic

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
It’s literally the first line of her rant

Read full topic

It’s because every time someone asks I feel even more shitty and when I feel shitty I don’t do things

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
Ok, maybe I didn’t come across how I meant

“Every time someone asks me how long the night is gonna be I prolong the night”

Seems pretty punitive to me though.

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Jazz
item.description:
Moleland:

So don’t blame us for your lack of time either

I didn’t…

Read full topic

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
And we get that, we do. But it’s nobody’s fault that you don’t have time. So don’t blame us for your lack of time either, and we won’t complain. Just calmly say, “Sorry about the delay, RL sucks - maybe weekend I can get this started” - We’d roll our eyes, and wait patiently (I’m sure)

Read full topic

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Jazz
item.description:
Ami:

I honestly expect a small level of professionalism, a thread rant imo isn’t professional in any way.

I’m not a professional FoL host

It is not a job, it is not an obligation, it is not a public service

It’s something people do for fun

People do lots of things

People have lots of feelings

And maybe some of these people don’t like being constantly reminded that they’re disappointing everyone and that they’re so useless they can’t even send out a few fuking PMs once a god damn week

So, for the sake of these people, be patient

Read full topic

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
Pretty much this. It was the tone of the message, not the message, that irked me.

Read full topic

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
Well, you see… I hadn’t seen any questions/answers publicly, So I wouldn’t know - I prolly should have DMed this TBF, but the tone of your post pissed me off, so clicked ‘Reply in new topic’ instead of ‘DM Boopydoop’

item.title: With the greatest respect
item.dc:creator: Ami
item.description:
I honestly expect a small level of professionalism, a thread rant imo isn’t professional in any way. A simple “IRL got in the way, will try to start it over the weekend” and it would be fine.
